blocks.text: Misconfigurations occur when systems are deployed with insecure or inappropriate settings. These are among the most common and easily exploitable vulnerability types.
Examples include open administrative interfaces, default passwords, excessive user privileges, and disabled logging.
Misconfigurations often arise from rushed deployments, poor documentation, or lack of standardized build processes.
Using configuration baselines, automated compliance checks, and infrastructure-as-code approaches helps reduce misconfiguration risk.
